name: SCRIPT KIDDO
description:
Concept

Take on the role of a hacker, cracking passwords of several targets using publicly available information that you gather from the web with the help of built-in tools

As you progress you will learn a thing or two, including what makes a good password & what to avoid when composing your own

Inspired by the well known 'KALI LINUX', this game / simulator is a good entry point for anyone interested in cybersecurity.

Made this in about 6 days & nights, for the Cyber Security Game Jam hosted by SecurityGames.io

Controls
  • KEYBOARD :  Type and Enter commands
  • MOUSE : Hold & Drag  or use the mouse-wheel to scroll through the command line 
Hints & Tips
  • Commands & naming are case sensitive so Frank is not the same as FrAnK or FRANK.
  • If things get messy or lost in the command line just type 'clear' for a fresh slate 
  • When you 'seek' the rose, a certain music track is played, that track cannot be played using 'shuffle'
  • If your stuck type 'tip' multiple times. It's a very useful command and your digital dice roll might not give you the one tip you need the first time around
